title: French Cuisine Terms
description: Test your knowledge of classic French culinary vocabulary used in kitchens worldwide

questions.question: What does the French culinary term 'amuse-bouche' refer to?
options: A single bite-sized appetizer served compliments of the chef

questions.question: In French cuisine, what is a 'roux'?
options: A mixture of fat and flour used to thicken sauces

questions.question: What does the French term 'confit' traditionally refer to?
options: Meat slowly cooked and preserved in its own fat

questions.question: What is a French 'beurre blanc'?
options: A warm emulsified butter sauce made with white wine and shallots

questions.question: In French cooking, what does 'en croute' mean?
options: Wrapped in pastry dough before baking

questions.question: What is a 'coulis' in French cuisine?
options: A thick sauce made from pureed and strained fruits or vegetables

questions.question: What does 'gratin' mean in French cooking?
options: A dish topped with cheese or breadcrumbs and browned under heat

questions.question: What is a 'ganache' in French pastry?
options: A smooth mixture of chocolate and cream

questions.question: In French cuisine, what is a 'cassoulet'?
options: A slow-cooked casserole of white beans and meat from southern France

questions.question: What does the term 'veloute' refer to in French cooking?
options: A smooth white sauce made with stock thickened by a roux

questions.question: What is a 'croquembouche'?
options: A towering French dessert made of choux pastry puffs bound with caramel

questions.question: In French culinary terminology, what does 'brunoise' describe?
options: A very fine dice cut of vegetables, typically 3mm cubes

questions.question: What is a 'bouquet garni' in French cooking?
options: A bundle of herbs tied together and used to flavor soups and stews
A flower arrangement for the table

questions.question: What does the French term 'charcuterie' refer to?
options: The craft of preparing and assembling cured meats and meat products

questions.question: In French cuisine, what is a 'clafoutis'?
options: A baked custard dessert traditionally made with black cherries
